did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Architectural plans, printed material, and correspondence.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Includes floor plans, photographs, drawings, renderings, transparencies, negatives, specifications, publicity and promotional material, correspondence with Cornell, hospital design material, reprints from LADIES HOME JOURNAL, and material on restoring an 18th century mill in New Jersey for Wells' own use.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Sanford B. Wells was an architect. Born in Middleburg, New York on April 23, 1908 or 1910, he graduated from the Cornell University College of Architecture. Working for other architectural firms or in private practice, his clients included L. Bamberger & Co., B. Altman & Co., R.H. Macy & Co., Bloomingdale Brothers, LADIES HOME JOURNAL, and the armed forces of Colombia, South America. He designed stores and store departments, residences, offices, and office and apartment buildings, and was also active in industrial design.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Includes floor plans, photographs, drawings, renderings, transparencies, negatives, specifications, publicity and promotional material, correspondence with Cornell, hospital design material, reprints from LADIES HOME JOURNAL, and material on restoring an 18th century mill in New Jersey for Wells' own use.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Sanford B. Wells papers, #3728. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
